ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Timepoint/visit label
Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
Are you knowledgeable about the current behavior of your child's biological father and able to answer questions about him?
1. Fails to give close attention to details or makes careless mistakes in my/his work or other activities
Notes: 1 = Never or Rarely; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often; 4 = Very Often

ElementDescription: 2. Has difficulty organizing tasks and activities
Notes: 1 = Never or Rarely; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often; 4 = Very Often

ElementDescription: 3. Avoids, dislikes, or is reluctant to engage in tasks that require sustained mental effort
Notes: 1 = Never or Rarely; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often; 4 = Very Often

ElementDescription: 4. Loses things necessary for tasks or activities
Notes: 1 = Never or Rarely; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often; 4 = Very Often

ElementDescription: 5. Is easily distracted by extraneous stimuli or irrelevant thoughts
Notes: 1 = Never or Rarely; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often; 4 = Very Often

ElementDescription: 6. Did you/your child's biological father experience any of these 5 symptoms at least 'Often' or more frequently?
7. How old were you/was your child's biological father when those symptoms began?
Notes: 1=Less than age 5; 2=Age 5, 3=Age 6; 4=Age 7; 5=Age 8; 6=Age 9; 7=Age 10; 8=Age 11; 9=Age 12; 10=Age 13; 11=Age 14; 12=Age 15; 13=Age 16; 14=Age 17 or Older; -999=I dont know

Notes: 0=Selected; 1=Not Selected

ElementDescription: 8e. In which of these settings did those symptoms impair your/your child's biological father's functioning? (choice=None)
Notes: 0=Selected; 1=Not Selected

ElementDescription: Blurt out answers before questions have been completed, complete others'' sentences, or jump the gun

ElementDescription: Interrupt or intrude on others (butt in conversations or activities without permission or take over what others are doing)

ElementDescription: Did you experience any of these symptoms at least ''often'' or more frequently?
Notes: 1 = No; 2 = Yes
